intro: Avenochloa requienii, commonly known as the African ricegrass, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with both male and female flowers, making it a monoecious species. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Avenochloa requienii is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor environments.
